content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "GRANTING OF COPYRIGHT." Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. Work subject to copyright. Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna" with different parts like "Di Shank". Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles like "Hurbin" and "Vilna", with different parts such as "Di Shank", "Der Ger-Tzadik", "Di Hiter fun der Shtot", "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern", and "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite". Other titles mentioned are "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir", "Dos Alte Hoyz" with alternate titles "Zin un Tahter" and "Der Beth-Horav", and "Fun Unter der Erd". In addition to Chaim Grade's works like "Hurbin" and "Vilna", other titles by the author include "Dos Alte Hoyz" with alternate titles "Zin un Tahter" and "Der Beth-Horav", "Fun Unter der Erd", "Yury Goresha", "Alte Boherim", "In Gerangl mitn Malah", "Chaim Nachman Bialik", "H. Leivik, der Poet fun Laydn un Goyrl", and "H. Leivik in Mayn Lehn and Shafn". In addition to Chaim Grade's works, other titles by the author include "Dos Alte Hoyz", "Fun Unter der Erd", "Yury Goresha", "Alte Boherim", "In Gerangl mitn Malah", and various works by other Yiddish writers like Itzik Manger, Mendele, I.L. Peretz, Sholem-Alaychem, and Anski. The collection also discusses the problems faced by Yiddish writers and in Yiddish literature. Chaim Grade's works include titles like "The Penitent", "Problems of a Yiddish Writer and Yiddish Literature", "My Path in Yiddish Literature", "I.L. Peretz", and "My Encounter with Soviet Yiddish Writers". Other works cover themes like "Young Vilna and its Milieu", "The Return to Zion", and "Three Dramatic Poems". Chaim Grade's works cover various themes such as "The Sabbath and the Weekdays in Yiddish Literature", "The Mussarists and the Lithuanian Yeshivas", "The Jewish Way of Life in Eastern Europe and Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov", and "The Talmudic Scholar in Yiddish Literature". Chaim Grade's works cover a range of topics including the Sabbath, Mussarists, Jewish life in Eastern Europe, and Talmudic scholars in Yiddish literature. Other works discussed include the memorial service for Count Potocki in Vilna, Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life, and the identity of Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia. Chaim Grade's works cover various topics such as Jewish life in Eastern Europe, Talmudic scholars, and the identity of Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia. Some of his lectures and essays include discussions on Saffed, Mount Miron, and the greening of Israel. Chaim Grade's lecture and essay titles include topics such as Jewish life in Vilna before World War II, the new Hebrew literature in Israel, and the survivors of the German concentration camps. Chaim Grade's works include titles such as "Thirty Years Later," "The Soil and the Legend of the Land of Israel," "The Last Controversies Among the Rabbis of Vilna," and "American Yiddish Poets." Additionally, any other works by Chaim Grade, whether published or unpublished, are also included.
